In materials science, 'dispersion' is the fraction of atoms of a material
exposed to the surface. In general:

:D = N S/N T

where D is the dispersion, N S is the number of surface atoms and
N T is the total number of atoms of the material. Dispersion is an
important concept in heterogeneous catalysis, since only atoms that are exposed
to the surface are able to play a role in catalytic surface reactions.
Dispersion increases with decreasing crystallite size and approaches unity at a
crystallite diameter of about 1Â nm.
